diff_user.system:
You are an expert data engineer specializing in converting data to text. Your task is to create a Python program that converts a list of triples into natural language text. The general topic is Airports. The program should implement a function called 'predict' that accepts a list of triples and generates a coherent, contextually relevant sentence that accurately represents the information contained in the triples. Ensure that the generated text is fluent, grammatically correct, and maintains the meaning of the original data. There can be multiple triples given that make up a complex sentence. Converting all those triples into one sentence will award greater score. An example of a complex sentence:
Triples:
(Antwerp | cityServed | Antwerp International Airport)
(Belgium | country | Antwerp)
(City of Brussels | capital | Belgium)
Example sentence:
"Antwerp International Airport serves the city of Antwerp which is in Belgium, where the capital is Brussels."

The 'predict' function returns that sentence as a string. Below is the list of all possible predicates that can be given as an input. With the given predicates and example triples implement the 'predict' function so it can process all the possible predicates:

Predicate: cityServed - Example triple: (Aarhus Airport | cityServed | "Aarhus, Denmark")
Predicate: elevationAboveTheSeaLevel - Example triple: (Aarhus Airport | elevationAboveTheSeaLevel | 25.0)
Predicate: location - Example triple: (Aarhus Airport | location | Tirstrup)
Predicate: operatingOrganisation - Example triple: (Aarhus Airport | operatingOrganisation | "Aarhus Lufthavn A/S")
Predicate: runwayLength - Example triple: (Aarhus Airport | runwayLength | 2776.0)
Predicate: runwayName - Example triple: (Aarhus Airport | runwayName | "10L/28R")
Predicate: country - Example triple: (Abilene, Texas | country | United States)
Predicate: isPartOf - Example triple: (Abilene, Texas | isPartOf | Jones County, Texas)
Predicate: 1stRunwayLengthFeet - Example triple: (Abilene Regional Airport | 1stRunwayLengthFeet | 3678)
Predicate: 1stRunwaySurfaceType - Example triple: (Abilene Regional Airport | 1stRunwaySurfaceType | Asphalt)
Predicate: 3rdRunwayLengthFeet - Example triple: (Abilene Regional Airport | 3rdRunwayLengthFeet | 7202)
Predicate: icaoLocationIdentifier - Example triple: (Abilene Regional Airport | icaoLocationIdentifier | "KABI")
Predicate: locationIdentifier - Example triple: (Abilene Regional Airport | locationIdentifier | "ABI")
Predicate: elevationAboveTheSeaLevelInFeet - Example triple: (Afonso Pena International Airport | elevationAboveTheSeaLevelInFeet | 2988)
Predicate: iataLocationIdentifier - Example triple: (Agra Airport | iataLocationIdentifier | "AGR")
Predicate: nativeName - Example triple: (Agra Airport | nativeName | "Kheria Air Force Station")
Predicate: leaderParty - Example triple: (Alcobendas | leaderParty | People's Party (Spain))
Predicate: capital - Example triple: (Alderney | capital | Saint Anne, Alderney)
Predicate: language - Example triple: (Alderney | language | English language)
Predicate: leader - Example triple: (Alderney | leader | Elizabeth II)
Predicate: owner - Example triple: (Alpena County Regional Airport | owner | Alpena County, Michigan)

Predicate: 4thRunwaySurfaceType - Example triple: (Amsterdam Airport Schiphol | 4thRunwaySurfaceType | "Asphalt")

Predicate: 4thRunwayLengthFeet - Example triple: (Andrews County Airport | 4thRunwayLengthFeet | 25)
Predicate: 1stRunwayNumber - Example triple: (Angola International Airport | 1stRunwayNumber | 5)

Predicate: administrativeArrondissement - Example triple: (Antwerp | administrativeArrondissement | Arrondissement of Antwerp)

Predicate: 3rdRunwaySurfaceType - Example triple: (Ardmore Airport (New Zealand) | 3rdRunwaySurfaceType | Poaceae)
Predicate: runwaySurfaceType - Example triple: (Atlantic City International Airport | runwaySurfaceType | "Asphalt/Concrete")

### Inspiration 1 (Score: 0.4492, Type: Experimental)
```python
from dataclasses import dataclass

@dataclass
class Triple:
    subject: str
    predicate: str
    object: str

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-START

def predict(triples: list[Triple]) -> str:
    """
    Generates a natural language sentence from a list of triples.
    """
    sentence = ""
    subject = ""
    for triple in triples:
        if not subject:
            subject = triple.subject
            sentence += f"{subject} "

        if triple.predicate == "cityServed":
            sentence += f"serves the city of {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "elevationAboveTheSeaLevel":
            sentence += f"is at an elevation of {triple.object} meters above sea level. "
        elif triple.predicate == "location":
            sentence += f"is located in {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "country":
            country = triple.object
            if "capital" in [t.predicate for t in triples if t.subject == country]:
                capital_triple = next(t for t in triples if t.subject == country and t.predicate == "capital")
                sentence += f"is in {country}, where the capital is {capital_triple.object}. "
            else:
                sentence += f"is in {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "capital":
            sentence += f"is the capital of {next(t.subject for t in triples if t.predicate == 'country' and t.object == triple.object)}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "iataLocationIdentifier":
            sentence += f"has an IATA identifier of {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "icaoLocationIdentifier":
            sentence += f"has an ICAO identifier of {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "runwayLength":
            if "runwayName" in [t.predicate for t in triples if t.subject == triple.subject]:
                runway_name_triple = next(t for t in triples if t.subject == triple.subject and t.predicate == "runwayName")
                sentence += f"has runway {runway_name_triple.object} with a length of {triple.object} meters. "
            else:
                sentence += f"has a runway length of {triple.object} meters. "
        elif triple.predicate == "runwayName":
            if "runwayLength" in [t.predicate for t in triples if t.subject == triple.subject]:
                runway_length_triple = next(t for t in triples if t.subject == triple.subject and t.predicate == "runwayLength")
                sentence = sentence[:-1] + f" with runway {triple.object} which is {runway_length_triple.object} meters long. "
            else:
                sentence += f"has a runway named {triple.object}. "
        else:
            if triple.predicate == "isPartOf":
                sentence += f"is part of {triple.object} which "
            elif triple.predicate == "language":
                sentence += f"speaks {triple.object}. "
            elif triple.predicate == "operatingOrganisation":
                sentence += f"is operated by {triple.object}. "
            else:
                sentence += f"has a {triple.predicate} of {triple.object}. "

    return sentence.strip()

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-END
```

from dataclasses import dataclass

@dataclass
class Triple:
    subject: str
    predicate: str
    object: str

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-START

def predict(triples: list[Triple]) -> str:
    """
    Generates a natural language sentence from a list of triples.
    """
    sentence = ""
    subject = ""
    for triple in triples:
        if not subject:
            subject = triple.subject
            sentence += f"{subject} "

        if triple.predicate == "cityServed":
            sentence += f"serves the city of {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "elevationAboveTheSeaLevel":
            sentence += f"is at an elevation of {triple.object} meters above sea level. "
        elif triple.predicate == "location":
            sentence += f"is located in {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "country":
            country = triple.object
            if "capital" in [t.predicate for t in triples if t.subject == country]:
                capital_triple = next(t for t in triples if t.subject == country and t.predicate == "capital")
                sentence += f"is in {country}, where the capital is {capital_triple.object}. "
            else:
                sentence += f"is in {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "capital":
            sentence += f"is the capital of {next(t.subject for t in triples if t.predicate == 'country' and t.object == triple.object)}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "iataLocationIdentifier":
            sentence += f"has an IATA identifier of {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "icaoLocationIdentifier":
            sentence += f"has an ICAO identifier of {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "runwayLength":
            if "runwayName" in [t.predicate for t in triples if t.subject == triple.subject]:
                runway_name_triple = next(t for t in triples if t.subject == triple.subject and t.predicate == "runwayName")
                sentence += f"has runway {runway_name_triple.object} with a length of {triple.object} meters. "
            else:
                sentence += f"has a runway length of {triple.object} meters. "
        elif triple.predicate == "runwayName":
            runway_name = triple.object
            runway_details = []
            for t in triples:
                if t.subject == triple.subject and t.predicate in ("runwayLength", "runwaySurfaceType"):
                    runway_details.append((t.predicate, t.object))

            if runway_details:
                details_string = ", ".join([f"{pred} is {obj} meters" if pred == "runwayLength" else f"has a {pred} of {obj}" for pred, obj in runway_details])
                sentence += f"has a runway named {runway_name} which {details_string}. "
            else:
                sentence += f"has a runway named {triple.object}. "
        else:
            if triple.predicate == "isPartOf":
                sentence += f"is part of {triple.object} which "
            elif triple.predicate == "language":
                sentence += f"speaks {triple.object}. "
            elif triple.predicate == "operatingOrganisation":
                sentence += f"is operated by {triple.object}. "
            else:
                sentence += f"has a {triple.predicate} of {triple.object}. "

    return sentence.strip()

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-END

# Current Program
```python
from dataclasses import dataclass

@dataclass
class Triple:
    subject: str
    predicate: str
    object: str

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-START

def predict(triples: list[Triple]) -> str:
    """
    Generates a natural language sentence from a list of triples.
    """
    sentence = ""
    subject = ""
    for triple in triples:
        if not subject:
            subject = triple.subject
            sentence += f"{subject} "

        if triple.predicate == "cityServed":
            sentence += f"serves the city of {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "elevationAboveTheSeaLevel":
            sentence += f"is at an elevation of {triple.object} meters above sea level. "
        elif triple.predicate == "location":
            sentence += f"is located in {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "country":
            country = triple.object
            if "capital" in [t.predicate for t in triples if t.subject == country]:
                capital_triple = next(t for t in triples if t.subject == country and t.predicate == "capital")
                sentence += f"is in {country}, where the capital is {capital_triple.object}. "
            else:
                sentence += f"is in {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "capital":
            sentence += f"is the capital of {next(t.subject for t in triples if t.predicate == 'country' and t.object == triple.object)}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "iataLocationIdentifier":
            sentence += f"has an IATA identifier of {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "icaoLocationIdentifier":
            sentence += f"has an ICAO identifier of {triple.object}. "
        elif triple.predicate == "runwayName":
            runway_name = triple.object
            runway_length = None
            runway_surface_type = None
            for t in triples:
                if t.predicate == "runwayLength" and t.subject == triple.subject:
                    runway_length = t.object
                if t.predicate == "runwaySurfaceType" and t.subject == triple.subject:
                    runway_surface_type = t.object

            if runway_length and runway_surface_type:
                sentence += f"has a runway named {runway_name} which is {runway_length} meters long and has a surface type of {runway_surface_type}. "
            elif runway_length:
                sentence += f"has a runway named {runway_name} which is {runway_length} meters long. "
            elif runway_surface_type:
                sentence += f"has a runway named {runway_name} with a surface type of {runway_surface_type}. "
            else:
                sentence += f"has a runway named {runway_name}. "
        else:
            if triple.predicate == "isPartOf":
                sentence += f"is part of {triple.object} and "
            elif triple.predicate == "language":
                sentence += f"speaks {triple.object}. "
            elif triple.predicate == "operatingOrganisation":
                sentence += f"is operated by {triple.object}. "
            else:
                if triple.predicate == "runwayLength":
                    sentence += f"has a runway length of {triple.object} meters. "
                else:
                    sentence += f"has a {triple.predicate} of {triple.object}. "

    return sentence.strip()

# EVOLVE-BLOCK-END
```
